review.title: Tolerable
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel (it's really a MOTEL and is now called Inn at Golden Gate, not Country Hearth) because it was the cheapest available that had onsite parking (though only some) near where I needed to be. I would have preferred a nice place and would have paid a little more for one, but there wasn't one available that fit what I needed. If I had been here for a vacation or other fun reason I'd have been sad about staying here but I was here for different reason so it didn't matter too much.  I just needed a place to rest in between.  That said, room was dark and depressing and the hotel is lacking in even basic amenities and comfort--e.g., I kept stabbing my leg on the corner of the platform bed frame, which is very close to the wall, no way to avoid it as the room was very tiny and crowded barely enough space to walk. Dangerously hot water from the taps/shower. Not enough blankets. Towels are too small and low quality and not enough of them. There's no coffee pot provided, the refrigerator made noise all night and didn't even really work--nothing was cold even when we turned up the cold dial--no bag for putting dirty laundry when checking out.  No heat in the shower part of the bathroom. The air smelled dirty inside the room. Upside: The front desk people were very nice, and the location on Lombard is on the Presidio fork so set back from the main/busy street and therefore is fairly quiet at night.
review.positiveRemarks: Location set back from busier part of street.  Free parking onsite, no valet hassle (though parking spots are limited and tiny). Friendly front desk
review.negativeRemarks: Pretty much everything else.  See the above "about your experience"
review.locationRemarks: Presidio and Lombard

review.title: Quiet hotel off the beaten path.
review.reviewText:
When we originally booked this hotel, I was concerned that it would be too far from the things we wanted to do.  It turned out the other way around.  There are no tourist shops nearby, and that was fine with us.  What was nearby was the Presidio, the Marina, The Palace of Fine Arts, and the restaurants and delis on Chestnut Street.  The bus that runs in front of the hotel can take you through the Presidio, then south past Golden Gate park, or, east far enough to catch another bus to Fisherman's wharf.  It's also a short walk from the hotel to the bus that runs up to the visitor center at Golden Gate Bridge, and assorted trails there.  I highly recommend getting a bus pass for however long you'll be there.

The hotel itself is an older hotel, but seems to have been remodeled in the last few years.  The bed was firm, and we slept very well.  The place was also quiet.  Our room had a refrigerator, but no coffee maker.  The "continental breakfast" seems to be more of an afterthought, but it was enough to get us going and out the door in the morning.  If your room has a refrigerator, you might want to take advantage of one of the small groceries on Chestnut.  Overall, it's a good hotel, in a good location off the beaten path, and I would stay there again without hesitation.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, quiet, staff, easy access to the bus lines.
review.negativeRemarks:
Plumbing, it was difficult to get the right temp in the shower.
Breakfast could use more variety.
review.locationRemarks: Quiet location away from the tourist focused areas.  Go to Marhall's or Baker Beach, take the Alcatraz tour.  The bus makes the whole city accessible.

review.title: Great deal for a San Francisco visit
review.reviewText: Country Hearth is more like a motel - it doesn't have a lot of frills. But, for a thrifty trip to SF it cannot be beat! The rooms are basic, and while there is a safe for laptops/valuables and an undercounter fridge, there is no coffee maker. But our rooms were clean and comfortable, beds were good, ample pillows. There is some kind of pastry and coffee set up in the morning but didn't try it so can't vouch for that. There are several places for breakfast and lunch right down Lombard St. In walking distance to the Presidio, which has beautiful views. You will need a cab/Uber to get to the BART, it is on a bus line (not sure about Muni.) The staff is super-helpful, friendly and really know the area well. Stayed for 2 nights, tried to extend for another, but they were booked solid - not surprised. Would definitely stay there again and would recommend to friends.

review.title: Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in.
review.reviewText:
Initial staff at check in were nice. Room was small, old carpet and the room had a mildew smell.Towels were old and some had holes in them. Furniture that was useless and not even worth writing about. NO COFFE MAKER in the room!!  No extra blanket and when I called to ask for one, they were closed. WHAT???  We ran out of toilet paper and my friend went down stairs to get a couple rolls from the maid. Some guy, don't know if he was the owner came out of the bottom corner room and asked why we were taking the toilet paper. This same guy was also eyeing us when we were outside waiting for our uber cab. 
We were up early and office was closed and still no coffee to be had!!! At check out, a young male receptionist said he had already charged my credit card. My understanding is that the card I used is for holding. I wanted to use another card for the room charge. In addition, my friends and I were splitting the charge. He said they couldn't split the cost that it had to be on one card..REALLY!? I reserved two nights via on line and informed verbally that my GF's were staying an extra night and that they were going to pay separately. At initial checkin they said that would be fine..no problem. At checkout (morning of day 2) went to pay and the receptionist had already charged a 3rd night to my card without my consent! Isn't that illegal? No reduced rate for sundays either. receptionist said "it's still the weekend!" Never again at this place!!

review.title: Nice Low Cost Option That Exceeded My Expectation
review.reviewText: We (my girlfriend and I) were traveling at the peak of summer tourist season in August.  There was a total lack of affordable hotel options in the city that week. We found this place our second night in the city, after spending the night in low cost hotel in the same area. We were pleased with the amenities and overall vibe offered by this place. Its not the Ritz, its a mom and pop place, but the room was clean, as were the sheets and bed. The facilities were older but fairly well maintained, even the towels were surprisingly soft. Nice new TV. The room had AC/Heat which was a really welcome luxury after our first night in that nearby place that didn't offer the same. The reviews are true that parking is limited, we however did not encounter any issues finding a spot. Plus (travel tip), the desk manager was totally cool letting us park the car ahead of room check-in so we could go to explore the city. The neighborhood is awesome close to pubs, SAFE, and very walker friendly. You are 5 blocks from the Palace of Fine Arts and within shot of fisherman's war. If you're on a budget, I recommend this place.

The breakfast is not much but it was nice to have something to eat before we caught a bus to go somewhere.

review.title: Comfortable accommodations near many attractions
review.reviewText: Staff were very friendly and helpful---we arrived there at 1am and the owner was very pleasant even though we had woken him up. They were also great in directing us to different areas and booking tours. Room was plain but clean and comfortable. Would stay here again.
the hotel was convenient to all locations but you get exactly what you pay for - it's not exactly the cleanest but we felt safe and it served its purpose.

review.title: Nice small motel
review.reviewText: Nice motel. Parking is small and is a first come, first serve basis. So you'll have to park outside if there are no room. Room was nice and clean. Very comfortable to stay. Nice area with barely any traffic on the street so it is easier to get in and out. Wish there was a little fridge though. There is coffee and hot chocolate in the office, and juice only in the morning. Would come here and stay again if I really need a place to stay when going to SF.

review.title: Out of the way.
review.reviewText:
The continental breakfast was nothing close.  

It was coffee and muffins.  

Cheap compared to other places.  Maybe stay again to be cheap.  But nothing special.

review.title: Rundown hotel on edge of good area
review.reviewText:
First, you don't want to stay here. You're going to drive up and realize you don't want to stay here, but don't get that far -- stop now. 

We booked two nights. Got in late, been traveling for 2 weeks, exhausted, but still should've turned around.
- stained sheets
- broken safe
- chain broken off door frame as if door was recently kicked in
- quarter inch gap between door and frame
- no second lock
- exterior facing doors--ours was in a dark corner on the second story
- all sorts of weird air purifiers that made it sound like you were inside a Diesel engine
- tried canceling second night but hotel refused because we were past checkout time (1:30--one of was sick so didn't leave the room until then but they didn't care)
- checked out anyway and went to the courtyard by Marriott on 2nd street for $40 more per night (highly recommended).

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText: Parking was terrible, room very small , over priced! Would not use your service again, sorry!

review.title: Old style motel close to Presidio.
review.reviewText:
Easy to find, not so easy to park. Only 6 parking slots in courtyard of motel, others have to park on the street (which is free). Owners very nice and accommodating with tips for restaurants and arranging travel to the airport.
Breakfast is sparse - only coffee, juice, fruit and pastries. Must take it back to room to eat because there is no room in the office.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast offerings
review.locationRemarks: Hotel on Lombard Street, but a 2 mile walk to the "crookedest road" section. Go one block north and catch a bus to the wharf area!

review.reviewText: This hotel is clean and offers free parking. It is also located within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and the Presidio. It's a great deal.

review.title: Affordable
review.reviewText: Affordable and clean, near presidio and palace of fine arts.  Did what it was supposed to do.

review.title: Location is the best part of this hotel
review.reviewText: Room was extremely small for the advertised price.  As a family of four we were pretty tightly squeezed to move about.  Continental breakfast consisted of coffee, juice, and donuts.  Our last morning there we stopped in for the 'breakfast' and there was nothing there and not a single person to ask about it.  Don't be fooled by the ad, parking is first come first serve so you are not guaranteed a parking spot with your paid room.  The best part of this hotel was that it was literally 2 blocks from the Presidio and a bus stop!

review.title: good for us
review.reviewText: Easy to find after a long drive. Luckily we were able to park at the Motel during our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very helpful sorting out our telephone issues.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was limited. Having travelled route 66 staying at many motels, we really missed a microwave oven.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Bridge. We used public transport to get around and there is a bus stop around the corner.

review.reviewText: Comfortable, clean, quiet place to spend the night

review.title: Good price
review.reviewText:
Clean, reasonably priced hotel.
The location was good for my business. it's 10 min walk to the Palace of Fine Arts, and 1 hour walk along the bay to the Fisherman's Wharf.
Note that number of parking places is limited (around 10), so if you need parking, you may be out of luck.
No coffee makers in the room, but free tea/coffee in the office.
review.negativeRemarks: coffee makers in the room
review.locationRemarks: Lunch in Liverpool LiL's

review.title: Good price for the neighborhood
review.reviewText: Hotel was adequate for our purpose. The price was good for the neighborhood. Staff was helpful and courteous. They recommended an excellent Indian restaurant within walking distance which served a great meal for a very reasonable price. We were one of the lucky few that got a parking space at the hotel. I may not have been as happy with our stay had we had to search elsewhere for parking.
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING

review.title: Close to Presidio
review.reviewText: Nice older hotel with very little parking. The location was perfect for visiting the Presidio and all the activities along the waterfront. Lots of nearby places to eat. The motel rooms were small but comfortable and suited our needs for 1 night. Even though this motel is on Lombard street it is on a quiet section of Lombard street not the main drag.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was perfect for my family. Easy to leave by the Golden Gate.
review.locationRemarks: We walked through the Presidio, along the Marina and trough the neighborhood with ease. Lots of food nearby.

review.title: Close to Presidio
review.reviewText: There are only 8 parking spaces for 40 rooms. Breakfast is minimal. Lots of other motels on Lombard to select from. Recommend you do that.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the beach
review.reviewText:
This Hotel was about 10 minutes walk to the waterfront.
the hotel was recently renovated and looks brand new compare to the other hotels in the area.
We had a wonderful vacation.
review.locationRemarks: Golden gate bridge waterfront is 10 minutes walk. Fisherman Wharf is 40 minutes walk, buses very close to hotel, takes you everywhere.

review.title: Convenient, clean, and comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms are on the smaller side, but the two double beds were comfortable and clean. It was also a very easy walk to all the shops and restaurants of the Marina District, the Presidio, the Palace of Fine Arts, and Crissy Field.

review.title: Quiet motel with friendly staff
review.reviewText:
Nice little motel close to the bay and close to great views of the Golden Gate Bridge. The staff are very accommodating and helpful.

It is a motel, not a five star hotel, but that worked for us as a young couple travelling. That said, our room was huge and in a great condition.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Location was great. Rates were reasonable and included wi-fi, parking and you got juice/coffee and a delicious pastry or muffin in the AM. Didn't hear the noise of nearby traffic. Felt safe.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very pleasant. Location

review.title: Clean and safe
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with this hotel. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. There is a convenient store and a couple of restaurants on the block and it's close to bus stops. The area is nice and we always felt safe. I liked that it's within walking distance of The Presidio and The Palace of Fine Arts and we enjoyed walking amongst the beautiful scenery. Great place!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Very clean and I felt completely safe there, in a great neighborhood with plenty of great restaurants near by. Also, the staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was a bit small and the rooms were a bit snug but still a great place for the great price.

review.title: Inexpensive hotel with great location
review.reviewText: I was looking for an inexpensive hotel that was not in the center of downtown. I did also not want to rent a car. This hotel is fairly close to Fishermans Warf and Golden Gate Bridge. The owners were super nice and friendly. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast is just pastry and fruit, but sufficient to get the day started. This is not a luxurious hotel, but I only planned to sleep there not spend my day there. If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel for your getaway, I would recommend this place!
review.positiveRemarks: The location and friendliness of the owners. It is run by a couple.
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure in the toilettes.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great sand save to walk at night. About a 40 minute Walt to Fishermans Warf. Two easy bus lines to the city center and Fishermans Warf

review.title: Quaint Lil Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a pleasing stay check in was fast and easy the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is well located within walking distance restaurants etc.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was limited just coffee and pastery
review.locationRemarks: The presidio, golden gate bridge, golden gate park, and chestnut street are all really close by.

review.title: For the price, this inn is nice!
review.reviewText: Nice, clean inn in the Marina District. Close to the Presidio, Palace of Fine Arts and bus stops.

review.title: Nice hotel for those who are frugal and want value
review.reviewText: Overall, I would say my stay was pretty good. My friends and I decided to take a weekend trip from Los Angeles, but we wanted to minimize the cost as well. This hotel, while it was out of the way for us, was nicely priced for the accommodations it had. The staff was nice when they checked us in and out; we even got a couple of maps of the place that were extremely helpful (especially when we needed to figure out which bus to take). This hotel didn't promise us much, but it did deliver very well on what it did.

the staff is not friendly
a lot of noise room are very uncomfortable

review.title: walking distance to marine , golden gate bridge.
review.reviewText: bathroom floor had long black hairs and also in bathtub. That made me and my wife sick to my stomach. Our bed was itchy even sheets appear to be clean, had to sleep over the blancket. Worried about security . Also, parking lot has only one way in and to get out you have to back up manover the car 2 or 3 times to be able to get out. Parking lot very narrow.

review.title: 2 Year anniversary Trip
review.reviewText: I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. We arrived early and the guy at the hotel allowed us to keep our bags there until check in. The front office staff was very helpful with directions and where we can grab something to eat. Everytime we went in they were nice. The Coffee and pastries were good enough to hold us off until we got ready to hit the town. I would definetly stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the cleanliness and service of this hotel. Loved the fact that there is a water filter.
review.negativeRemarks: I was ok with everything
review.locationRemarks: located around the Marina district, theres a walgreens a liquor store and walking distance to Chestnut and the bus stops.

review.title: For the price it was a nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: The hotel was located near the places we wanted to go,and we had free parking that bad for the price.

review.title: Nice friendly hotel close to bus route
review.reviewText: Staff were extremely friendly and helpful ! Hotel is basic but clean and comfortable. It is in a very safe place with many embassies in near proximity ! Stayed there for 3 nights and it was easy to get to china town on the number 46 bus and also the bus to the cable car and walking distance to fishermans wharf was about an hours stroll which we did in an evening and felt very safe ! The continental breakfast is a pastry and coffee but that was enough to get us by until mid morning !

review.title: Very nice place to visit
review.reviewText: We are low maintenance travelers. Give us a clean, quiet place to sleep and a safe place for our luggage, and we're happy. This provided that, and the staff were knowledgeable and helpful, arranging for airport transportation and helping us negotiate the bus system so we could get around. We had a nice walk to the Greens Restaurant, and this is less than a block from the Presidio.

review.title: Nice hotel friendly staff
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a clean and comfortable place to spend the night, go no further. Country Hearth Inn is the place.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and comfortable rooms, great quiet location, helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast : they could add some bagels with butter or cream cheese
review.locationRemarks: Near Palace of Fine Arts, Golden Gate Bridge, Presidio Park, nice restaurants, and stores.

review.title: good neighborhood and silent
review.reviewText: Friendly stuff, good price and clean room. It is close to the Golden Gate.

review.title: Good location, clean, simple and affordable.
review.reviewText: We stayed for five days at this hotel, and were quite pleased. It was certainly good value for money. We walked to the Golden Gate across the Presidio (takes about 50 min), and bus n. 30 took us downtown in about 15 min. There is no lift, so if you have very heavy luggage, ask for a ground floor room.
review.negativeRemarks: The room could do with a microwave. The heater did not have a thermostat (or it was broken), so it was a bit hard to adjust the temperature.
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate, and the Presidio are near by. You can also walk to Fishermen's Wharf, takes about one hour.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to a lot of restaurants
Very nice stay, enjoyed the location a lot.
review.reviewText: The hotel was affordable. It was simple but clean. The location was great, close to the Presidio Park and Palace Fine Arts (Marina District), short drive/bus ride to the Golden Gate Bridge. There is a Walgreens about 2 blocks from the hotel. You can take the Metro Bus on Chestnut or Lombard and it pretty much takes your everywhere for $2/person (for 3 hours). Hotel offers a small breakfast, muffins/croissants/danishes, coffee/tea/juice, fruit. (no place to sit, you can bring a tray and take to eat in your room). I recommend this hotel and I would go back.
review.locationRemarks: Palace Fine Arts, Presidio - walking distance by Bus - Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf , Alcatraz, Union Square, Coit Tower, Ghirardeli Square

review.title: Nice room for a night or two
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed. Quiet room, no road noise. Bathroom nice enough. Wouldn't want to stay here many nights in a row, fine for a night or two. The cleaning could be improved. But nothing gross: like mold or cigarette smoke, no strange odors. Humidity in room was fine. Surrounding area was safe.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning

review.reviewText: A basic room,an OK place to spend the night, not to hang out in. Pretty good location, friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
We wanted a quaint motel within walking distance of golden gate bridge and fishermans wharf..3 mile circumferance..this is an affordable,nice motel.The tradeoff for this motel is..walls are thin,limited parking.
Will definitely stay again..

review.title: Decent hotel close to the SF bay area.
review.reviewText:
This hotel was just what we needed. Since the hotels in SF are extremely expensive
we were hoping to find an affordable hotel that was clean and comfortable and that is
what we got. For less than $100.00 we had a clean comfortable room in a safe neighborhood
on Lombard street. The staff was very helpful in helping us find things and even went out
of their way to help us find the tour bus. I would highly recommend a stay in this hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Great customer service, clean and comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: The continental breakfast is coffee, juice and pastry from a local bakery but they don't have room for anything else.
review.locationRemarks: Safe location on Lombard Street and a quick car or bus ride to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Close to all.
review.reviewText: Took a impulse last minute trip, this little place is down the way from The Palace of Fine Art's and the Marina ,You can walk to Chestnut street and find a variety of Restaurants and shops. The staff were extremely friendly and very accommodating . The wi-fi worked well and helped in planning trips it's real close to the Golden Gate Bridge .Oh I forgot to mention it was the best price ever at the last minute.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: The Palace of Fine Arts , Presidio, Marina and Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Great location; good value and room
review.reviewText: This motel is located in the Marina District of SF on Lombard St one of the busiest traffic streets in SF, BUT the motel is located on the first block and it had NO traffic!! Therefore, NO TRAFFIC NOISE. Parking is limited, but I had no issue finding parking on nearby streets. Great location and neighborhood. Excellent free coffee in the morning and pastries from a real SF bakery and not wrapped in cellophane. The bed was harder than I am used to but sheets and bed spread were good and clean. The room and bathroom was very clean, though there were barely enough towels. TV had Comcast cable and it worked and the room was a bit cold and we used the heater and it worked. Also included in the room was a frig, blow dryer and iron. No microwave. The furnishings were comparable to a Super Eight motel. Not worn and tired. The owner was terrific;helpful and personable.For the price, this place far exceeded what I would have expected and I can recommend it without reservations.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and nicely furnished and the staff was great.
review.negativeRemarks: more towels in bathroom. only enough for one person. A microwave would be good, too.
review.locationRemarks: close to Golden Gate Bridge and lots of places to eat on Chestnut St.

review.title: So so Hotel
review.reviewText:
For an average of $200 per night, it's really not worth staying at this hotel. The room was small, and tight. Someone smoking at my door step, smokes got in to the room. The room is run down and housekeeping didn't make up our room. The breakfast was really basic so don't expect too much.
It's quite a distance to Fisherman's Wharf if you wish to walk....
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast, cleaning of room on daily basis
review.locationRemarks: Museum of Fine Art is just blocks away

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is not fancy by any means but the room was very clean and it served our purposes for the weekend.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and several good restaurants in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: There isn't much parking. We parked our car in their lot for the whole weekend but our daughter had to park on the street.
review.locationRemarks: It is within easy walking distance of the Presidio and Palace of Fine Arts and about a 2 1/2 - 3 mile walk to the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Not Great!
review.reviewText:
The mattress was old and uncomfortable. No in-room coffee and the office was closed at 9:00 PM until 7 AM.
The bathtub was missing a stopper, so why have a bath-tub? Over-all, this hotel did not seem to justify the rate it charges for rooms. The room was clean at least!
review.negativeRemarks: at least supply coffee in the rooms and replace the mattresses.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do near-by. Had to walk 15 minutes to the nearest bus stop and it's about a 25 minute bus-ride downtown, if you can get a bus at all.

review.title: Central location on bus route
review.reviewText: Friendly staff clean good location number 30 bus straight to pier 39 parking spaces tight but this sanfrancisco overall very satisfied

review.title: Three rating is probably too much
review.reviewText: Three rating is probably too much but two rating is probably too little. It gets the job done. In a clean, safe part of town. Don't count on finding on-site parking. But alternative parking is usually Close by.
review.positiveRemarks: No price, decent part of town, got the job done
review.negativeRemarks: The TV Was ancient
review.locationRemarks: 24 hour Walgreens

review.title: Late night accommodations
review.reviewText: We arrived just before midnight at this hotel, and although the designated parking spots were taken, the manager let us park in a "non-spot." Even though I got up early to make sure another car could exit, I really appreciated this accommodation! We had a comfortable stay and we would definitely book here again. We had breakfast plans, so we did not take advantage of the continental breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and comfortable. The manager was nice to us.
review.locationRemarks: We attended a concert at Yoshi's San Francisco, drove to a nearby restaurant for a late dinner, and then to the Country Hearth Inn.

review.title: Location is key
review.reviewText: We spent 8 nights at the Country Hearth Inn. Having never been to San Francisco, I picked it pretty much at random from several options based on rates and location near the Presidio. When we got there it was obvious we got the right one. Some of the other options were just blocks away and all on one of the busiest, loudest streets in town. Being a block and a half away made all the difference.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean, inside and out. The staff were all very friendly and helpful with any questions we had. The location was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was meager at best, Muffins, fruit, coffee and Juice. But considering the tiny size of the lobby it's all they could do.
review.locationRemarks: The Presidio, a bistro, pizza place, a trendy restaurant, a market/deli, a sports bar and public transportation all within a block.

review.title: Good location, safe area, free parking
review.reviewText:
We stayed 5 nights here in August. chose as parking was available at motel or round streets for free. Safe area and easy to travel from here by bus.
Motel was basic, no frills. Staff polite and helpful. Room was clean. Pastries and coffee, juice available each morning.
For the price it was absolutely fine and as two women travellers we felt safe at motel and in the area
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Bridge. Palace of fine arts, north beach, chestnut road shops, restaurants and bars. 40 min walk to fishermans wharf or regular buses

review.title: Awesome hotel for the price
review.reviewText:
Couple who own the hotel were friendly and knowledgeable. Close to bus stops. $10 cab ride to the wharf. The only disappointing thing was the 'continental' breakfast - basically some fruit and day old pastries, with juice & coffee.

Additionally, parking is VERY limited. But between transit and cabs you really don't need a vehicle unless you're planning on leaving San Francisco for day trips.
review.positiveRemarks: The price! We also had 4 girls in the room - it was helpful that the shower/toilet were separate from the sink/mirror area.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Wharf is close - $10 cab ride. Also, the hop on/off busses stop nearby.

review.title: GOOD PRICE - LIMITED PARKING
review.reviewText: I NEEDED A REASONABLY PRICED ROOM AT THE LAST MINUTE AND FOUND THE COUNTRY HEARTH INN. THE ROOMS ARE DATED, BUT CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE, AND GIVEN THE TIME OF YEAR AND THE LOCATION, THE PRICE WAS RIGHT. THE ONLY PROBLEM WITH THIS PROPERTY IS THE VERY LIMITED AND VERY CRAMPED PARKING. THERE ARE INSUFFICIENT PARKING SPACES TO ACCOMMODATE ALL GUESTS AND THE EXISTING PARKING SPACES ARE DESIGNED FOR SMALL/COMPACT AUTOS (NOT AN SUV OR MINIVAN ETC). STREET PARKING IS AVAILABLE BUT ITS NOT ALWAYS EASY TO FIND NOR PROXIMAL TO THE PROPERTY. IF YOU PARK ON THE STREET, BE CERTAIN TO GET UP EARLY TO MOVE YOUR VEHICLE BEFORE BEING TICKETED.
review.positiveRemarks: THE HOTEL IS LOCATED IN A SAFE NEIGHBORHOOD IN THE MARINA DISTRICT OF SAN FRANCISCO, AND THE PRICE WAS NOT ASTRONOMICAL LIKE MOST SAN FRANCISCO HOTELS
review.negativeRemarks: THE ROOMS WERE OUTDATED (BUT CLEAN), AND THE PARKING WAS ABYSMAL
review.locationRemarks: LOTS OF RESTAURANTS, AND OTHER NIGHT LIFE NEARBY, AND WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE TO THE SAN FRANCSICO MARINA AND FISHERMAN'S WHARF (LONGER DISTANCE).

review.title: only because of location
review.reviewText: plastic on bottom mattress, entire patio washed down from second story dripping water as we moved in our gear and making prints on our already dirty carpet. only one washcloth in towel set of two bath towels, two hand towels. very limited parking. wanted extra $3 for renting fridge absolutely no guestsallowed...really?

review.title: Unacceptable
review.reviewText: This hotel was unacceptable. The room was very small and smelled like cats. There was only 6 parking spaces, first come first serve, and you had to back out into a busy street. Otherwise, you had to park on the street. The neighborhood was seedy and you had to walk several blocks to a decent restaurant or shop.
review.negativeRemarks: A more honest website picture and description of hotel

review.title: Good hotel for the price and location
review.reviewText: This hotel met our expectations for everything except free parking. The hotel lot only accommodates 8 cars! We had trouble finding room on the streets nearby and one night parked on a street due for street sweeping the next day so we got a $64 ticket. We weren't parked near the sign so we missed it. Had trouble with the room safe but someone came up the next morning and fixed the problem. We were happy to rent the refrigerator for $3 because we were staying for 5 nights and the price was for the entire stay. Muffins in the morning were good but it got boring after 5 days. It was an OK place to stay but we will try something else next time we visit San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked that it was close to where we wanted to go.
review.negativeRemarks: Change up the breakfast pastries.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is close to fishermen's wharf, restaurants, the Presidio park, places to shop. We needed to be in Pacific Heights so it was also close.

review.title: Staying In SF
review.reviewText:
The only value would be the location.
Otherwise it is a low budget hotel for more money than it is worth.
If you plan to park your car at the motel better get there early as they are not enough spots to accommodate all customers.
review.negativeRemarks: Run down
review.locationRemarks: Close to fisherman's wharf and the Presidio

review.title: Great Location and great price
review.reviewText: We wanted to save money on a place to sleep and this hotel was perfect. We were able to park our car for free and have a true city experience. Right next door to the Presidio (near the Yoda Statue) and a great little Pizza Joint. Major bus line across the street. We have 2 children, 5 and 7, and we walked from the hotel to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Union Square and then bussed home. It was great fun!

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText:
You can be sure you will stay clean and big room. But you can hear voices belong to other rooms.
Hotel is end of Lombart St close to Fine Art, Golden Bridge. You can go to Fisherman Wharf by bus (10 min). In San Francisco, public transportion is good. You don't wait bus long time. If you want only clean room, you can choose this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Especially voices belong other rooms
review.locationRemarks: close to Fine Art, Golden Bridge. Fisherman Wharf is 10 min by bus, Union Sitation is 25-30 min by bus

review.title: Great, clean, safe choice if you're on a budget
review.reviewText: We stayed here for three nights and were very pleased with the accommodations. This hotel is pretty "no frills," as the price and description suggest, but it met our needs just fine. The room was clean and the hotel felt safe. The advertised "continental breakfast" included coffee, pastries, and fruit. There are several MUNI (pubic transportation) lines that run close to the hotel. I would definitely return to this hotel in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the price, location, safety, and location.
review.negativeRemarks: They could put the WI-FI password in the room instead of making you ask for it.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the Golden Gate Bridge from here (long walk) IHOP about a 1/2 mile away (Walgreens even closer) Pizza restaurant very close by -decent

review.title: should have more parking available.
review.reviewText: with 30 rooms available, there should be more parking available to guests. It was ridiculous that there were only 8 parking spots including handicapped. Not happy whatsoever

review.title: Nice but Noisy
review.reviewText: The cleanliness, comfort and service was great, but the rooms are quite noisy. You can hear the street traffic even with the door and window closed. It was also very easy to hear people talking in the adjoining rooms. You couldn't understand what they were saying but still it was quite distracting.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect for the conference I attended in the Presidio.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were noisy
review.locationRemarks: Located where Lombard street enters the Presidio this hotel is walking distance to "Cow Hollow" for shopping and restaurants.

review.title: you pay peanuts you get monkeys
review.reviewText: Picked this hotel from Expedia's list as it is walking distance to the Golden Gate bridge and the waterfront, however the male (not the female) office staff are not friendly (no smile, hi or hello when you see them), not helpful (I was told by another male staff who is from another city that he doesn't know about the double decker sightseeing buses as he is new) and very rude (when I asked how to use the coffeemaker, the male staff said "read the sign".
review.negativeRemarks: the male staff
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to the Golden Gate bridge but way too far to downtown where the prime shopping area is

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Conveniently located close to Golden Gate Bridge and Park, Presidio, biking trails, not too far from Fishermen's wharf. The owners were very helpful and attended our requests. Self-served breakfast is basic but appreciated. Parking is limited but had no trouble finding parking in the street a few steps from the hotel

review.title: OK for overnight stay
review.reviewText: Very close to the Palace of Fine Arts and the Golden Gate Bridge. Parking is very limited - 7 spaces, so we were lucky to get the last spot there. Our room was up on the 2nd floor right next to the cafe building - their kitchen is pretty loud. You'll hear a lot of noise until 11 p.m. On the bright side - the motel is not facing any busy intersections, so the noise from the street is minimal.Everything worked just fine in the room. Beds were OK. Some pastries and coffee provided in the morning. I'd stay there again but ask for a room away from the cafe.

review.title: Just what we needed
review.reviewText: Our family of four recently visited San Francisco for spring break. We spent the days out and about and came home in the late evenings. We got exactly what we expected from Country Hearth Inn. They are in a great location and even have some parking. We felt safe and comfortable in the neighborhood. The staff was helpful and accommodating. Have breakfast down Lombard at Home Plate.
review.negativeRemarks: It's a city, and there is street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic.

review.title: Great value.
review.reviewText: I think the staff increases the rating by at least one star. They went above the call of duty when they got a room ready for me extra early. I was very pleased and would definitely go back. I would totally stay there again.

review.title: Dissappointed
review.reviewText: The hotel was not conveniently located. The continental braekfast was a joke, it consisted of a coffe machine, a juice machine, a box of cakes and pastries ordered in and there was never enough, a bowl of fruit (apples and one day bananas as well), this was all located in the small office area. There was no tea or coffee making facilities in your room. We were located on the second floor, there were no lifts, and no offer to carry our (2 females) luggage up the stairs. For the price I wxpected more. Very dissappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Location, we were mislead about how close it was to Fishermans Wharf, we had to walk and catch 2 buses to get there.
review.locationRemarks: Out of the way

review.title: Okay Hotel
review.reviewText:
An ok hotel, provided the basics. Contenental breakast included muffins, danish, cofee, juice, tea, apples and bananas. There were no coffee machine in the room.

Generally quiet in the late evenings except for some load mouth incondiserate hotel guest who don't even know how to closed their doors quietly.
review.negativeRemarks:
Use of fridge in room would cost extra which was strange. We passed.

Calling charge for local phone calls. I think this is never a good thing!
review.locationRemarks: Location was ok but had to take the bus to all of the main SF attractions. It would have been good if there were more restuarants closer to walk to.

review.title: Keep looking elsewhere
review.reviewText:
First thing on arrival was "great that there is free parking - too bad there's no place to park!"
When I asked at the desk I was just told "it's full". Not helpful. So had to find a place on the street to park overnight - which is not easy to do in San Francisco.
The room was much smaller than it appeared in the pictures and the little frig was locked and was only available for another three dollars.
The TV was poor quality and there really were no amenities.
We also had noisy people above us which came right through and we finally had to ask them to quiet down.
The one positive is that it is a nice neighborhood.
review.negativeRemarks: The room.
review.locationRemarks: The one good thing.

review.title: A comfortable stay in a good area
review.reviewText: A good hotel within walking distance of the Exploratorium and bay. Clean room with a suitable breakfast in the morning. Staff were friendly and helpful. Parking was a bit limited, but you just had to be up early to catch the spaces of people checking out. Parking nearby is fine overnight anyway. Area had lots of good bars and restaurants. Golden Gate Bridge is a 30 minute walk. Fisherman's Wharf was about a 45 minute walk. Buses are excellent throughout San Francisco if you have walked too much! The only little pain was the noise from the kitchen of the nearby bar that backs on to the car park. Overall, a good stay in a good location.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet location with good transport links to all areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from the nearby kitchen and room above.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of bars, restaurants and shops nearby. Easy walking distance of Golden Gate Bridge and Bay area.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: This hotel was not at all what was described. The promised refrigerator in room had to be rented for three dollars. The "continental breakfast" was horrible coffee, bad pastries and tiny apples. The free parking was very limited and I got blocked in by another car during the night. Our room adjoined a restaurant, so we could hear noise from the restaurant kitchen most of the night. I have paid less for a hotel in the same neighborhood which was much, much nicer. This was extremely overpriced, which made me expect more. It was very disappointing. We would never stay there again.

review.title: Good two star motel near Presidio
review.reviewText: Basic, clean, 2 star motel with a good location next to the Presidio and the Palace of Fine Arts. Best for tourists on a budget who want to be close to the Golden Gate Bridge. Very nice, helpful woman at the front desk. Our room #28 had a refrigerator and water filters and looked out on a neighbor's garden. It was probably the quietest room there. We stayed there for the 75th Anniversary of the GG Bridge and it was fine. The Final Final is a good sports bars on the same block, as well as Liverpool Lil's Bar.
review.locationRemarks: Near Presidio, Palace of Fine Arts and Golden Gate Bridge. Not close to downtown.

review.title: OK - clean enough for the price.
review.reviewText: The hotel seemed solidly built and was decently clean. The carpet was quite worn as were the linens but they were clean and worthy of a 2.5-star hotel. The parking is quite limited so get there early as street parking is virtually non-existant and not guaranteed. There was some sort of an air cleaner in the room that would provide white noise if needed. I wore earplugs and had a good night's sleep. You have to pay extra to use the refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: A few blocks off of the main Lombard, you need to stay left or you'll end up on the Golden Gate onramp and take the last turnoff into the Presdido.

review.title: Nice small inn next to Presidio
review.reviewText: Good value. Room is clean but not fancy, and parking is free but quite limited.

review.title: WORST HOTEL OF THE TRIP
review.reviewText:
Unhelpfun staff
rock hard bed
not really a breakfast at all
in a two month holiday of the states this is the worst hotel i stayed in
review.negativeRemarks: bed and service
review.locationRemarks: We walked to the golden gate bridge and fishermans warft however buses run frequestly around the area as well

review.title: Good motel in a really nice neighbourhood
review.reviewText: The motel is in a really nice area, in the marina district, just a couple of blocks away is the Palace of Fine Arts and Crissy Field. The room was very clean. There are quite a few good places to eat near the hotel, Liverpool Lil's was very good, and Original Buffallo Wings was great for breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: The Sutro District is really nice, you can see Sutro Baths, Ocean Beach and there is a beautiful coastal trail where you can get great views of Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText: While this hotel was in a great location, the room was the worse I've ever been in. To start, it was clear the bed had not been changed but rather re-made. The pillows did not have dust covers on them and hair, not mine, was on one of them. Plus, the bed itself did not have a basic mattress cover under the sheet. The mattress was just covered with a very thin sheet (not even fitted) over the mattress! I added a towel from the bathroom under me to sleep on this rock-hard and uncomfortable mattress. The bathroom showed signs of wear & tear with mold in cracks by the tub ground in dirt by the door jam. To add insult to injury, the maid left an envelope on the room desk for "tips". The tv had no local/national channels but only music channels that I could find. At 6:30 am the next morning the front desk which was suppose to have coffee ready was closed. I walked down the street to a gas station/mini-market to get coffee. Had I not arrived so late at check-in I would have moved to another hotel. This was a surprise given all the positive comments I reviewed prior to booking my room.

review.title: Perfect Budget Stay in SF
review.reviewText: Can't go wrong with this place. We needed a cheap room in a decent location and we hit the bulls eye. Parking was a plus.

review.title: I will never stay anywhere else in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I lived in San Francisco for three years and go back very often. Most hotels there cost more than three times what this one does, and can be noisy and a hassle. All you have to do is figure out the buses and not be in a big hurry and the Country Hearth Inn is the perfect choice. It is in an unbeautiful neighborhood, but is just a few streets below the most stunning blocks of Pacific Heights, and is right next to the Presidio. You can ****PARK YOUR CAR**** there off street and for free, but there aren't many spaces. The people who run ther Country Hearth are very sweet and helpful. It is amazingly easy to find. Your fellow guests are modest travelers and agreeable.

review.title: Great find
review.reviewText: Great hotel and good base from which to tour the city. I was looking for a cheap one to bundle with our plane tickets to SF, and there are apparently a lot of hotels with bedbugs in the city! Not here--just a clean, comfortable room in a quiet hotel with friendly staff. 5 or 6 spaces in the parking lot but you can park on the street too. Great for getting in to see the city. Backed up against the Presidio, right on Lombard. Walk a block down and one street over to Chestnut to catch the #30 bus straight to Fisherman's Wharf, Embarcadero, Financial District...also the #28 comes even closer and will take you west right to the Golden Gate Bridge. Close to a Walgreens, a pub and a Pluto's restaurant/salad bar. Good neighborhood. Continental bfast was pastries from some local bakery. I'd stay there again quick.

review.title: Nice hotel, great value in a nice neighborhood
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a fancy hotel with all the amenities, this place is not for you. However, if you are looking for a nice, clean hotel on a budget then this is your place! The neighborhood is partly residential, nice and quiet. Our room was very clean and we were glad to see an iron & ironing board. The bed was comfy! There is a fridge but you have to rent it ($3/day).The staff are very nice. and they can arrange tours for you or a shuttle to the airport ($15/person). In the morning there is coffee, tea, juice, fruit and pastries at the front desk but because the area is very small you have to take your breakfast back to your room. No prob. There is no restaurant but there are plenty of eateries within walking distance. There are several buses in the area to take you downtown or to Fisherman's Wharf. There's also a Walgreen's drugstore 2 blocks away in case you forgot anything. I would stay here again.

review.title: No frills.....but clean and comfortable
review.reviewText:
This is a no-frills place, but it is clean and comfortable. And the location can't be beat.

If you are just looking for a clean, comfortable place to sleep, this is one of the best bargains in The City.

review.title: Not great, not bad, just okay
review.reviewText: Close walk to Presidio, Palace of the Arts and Exploratorium. About 2 mile hike to the Wharf. Parking is very limited. Outside is a little run down, but bathroom newly remodeled and very nice. They charge $3.00/day to rent a tiny refrigerator....really??? Free pastries,orange juice and coffee in the AM. If you're in San Fran to sightsee and vacation, it's reasonably priced for your needs!

review.title: Good place for the money in the heart of the Marina dsitrict
review.reviewText: The room was fine and the people were eager to help when we needed anything. The breakfast isnt much (coffee, muffin, apple, thats it) but its better than nothing. Parking is free but there are only 6 spaces so your on the street if you dont get back early.

review.title: Very dark and stuffy
review.reviewText: The room was clean just very dark and stuffy.

review.title: This is where we will stay on our next trip to San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful with directions and sightseeing information. Hotel located in nice residential area and felt very safe. Can see the Golden Gate Bridge from the corner a couple of blocks from hotel. Bus route close by and very affordable to use to tour city. The only mishap we had was a staff member walked into room without knocking. He apologized. We reported this and he was instructed not to enter rooms without knocking. Also, housecleaning came in while we were gone to breakfast and starting cleaning room (stripped bed, took towels) before we had removed our possessions. Nothing was missing. We would still stay here again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good value

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: It was very noisy outside. There was no parking spaces available. We had to find spot out on the side streets. The beds were very uncomfortable.

review.title: good SF hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was overall quite satisfactory. The only complaint I had was that the kitchen in the adjacent building was rather noisy. (Obviously that isn't the hotel's fault.) I will probably stay there again on future trips.

review.title: Good building, bad people.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location and there's a good price per night; however, there are a few warnings. Don't count on a parking spot. This was one of the reasons why I chose this place but, as it turns out, you ended up having to vulture around for a spot. What's worse, the staff was extremely rude to the point of disrespect and barely spoke English. They want to charge you for pretty much any item that you need. They claimed to loan out refrigerators but then wanted money for the loaner. If you care about customer service, this is not the place for you.
